meanings.def: to become hard, and often turn to ice, as a result of extreme cold; to make something do this
examples: Water freezes at 0°C.
It's so cold that even the river has frozen.
freeze something The cold weather had frozen the ground.
freeze + adj. The clothes froze solid on the washing line.
freeze something + adj. The frost had frozen the ground hard.
Last year's cold spell froze the lake solid.

meanings.def: if a pipe, lock or machine freezes, or something freezes it, it becomes blocked with frozen liquid and therefore cannot be used
examples: The pipes have frozen, so we've got no water.
freeze up I kept the car running to stop the engine freezing up.
freeze something Ten degrees of frost had frozen the lock on the car.

meanings.def: when it freezes, the weather is at or below 0° Celsius
examples: It may freeze tonight, so bring those plants inside.

meanings.def: to be very cold; to be so cold that you die
examples: Every time she opens the window we all freeze.
Two men froze to death on the mountain.
freeze somebody Two men were frozen to death on the mountain.

meanings.def: to keep something, especially food, at a very low temperature in order to preserve it
examples: Can you freeze this cake?
The organ samples were immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen.

meanings.def: to be able to be kept at a very low temperature
examples: Some fruits freeze better than others.

meanings.def: to stop moving suddenly because of fear, etc.
examples: I froze with terror as the door slowly opened.
(figurative) The smile froze on her lips.
The police officer shouted ‘Freeze!’ and the man dropped the gun.
Suddenly, Ronny seemed to freeze.
He was so surprised he froze to the spot.
Maggie's face had frozen into a cold mask.
She froze with horror when she saw the body.

meanings.def: when a computer screen freezes, you cannot move any of the images, etc. on it, because there is a problem with the system
to stop a film or video in order to look at a particular picture
examples: Freeze the action there!

meanings.def: to hold wages, prices, etc. at a fixed level for a period of time
examples: Salaries have been frozen for the current year.
Prices have been frozen at this level for over a year now.

meanings.def: to prevent money, a bank account, etc. from being used by getting a court order which bans it
examples: The company's assets have been frozen.

meanings.def: to make you extremely frightened or shocked
to suddenly stop because something has frightened or surprised you
examples: Jess froze in her tracks and took a deep breath.

meanings.def: to suddenly make somebody stop by frightening or surprising them; to suddenly stop because something has frightened or surprised you
examples: The question stopped Alice in her tracks.
Suddenly he stopped dead in his tracks: what was he doing?
(figurative) The disease was stopped in its tracks by immunization programmes.

idioms.idiom: freeze your blood | make your blood freeze
idioms.def: to make you extremely frightened or shocked
to suddenly stop because something has frightened or surprised you
examples: Jess froze in her tracks and took a deep breath.

idioms.idiom: stop/halt somebody in their tracks | stop/halt/freeze in your tracks
idioms.def: to suddenly make somebody stop by frightening or surprising them; to suddenly stop because something has frightened or surprised you
examples: The question stopped Alice in her tracks.
Suddenly he stopped dead in his tracks: what was he doing?
(figurative) The disease was stopped in its tracks by immunization programmes.

meanings.def: the act of keeping wages, prices, etc. at a particular level for a period of time
examples: a wage/price freeze
freeze on something a freeze on bus fares
It's too expensive to lift the freeze on pay.
The government has imposed a price freeze on bread.
a freeze on imports
a total freeze on gas emissions

meanings.def: an unusually cold period of weather during which temperatures stay below 0° Celsius
examples: Farmers still talk about the big freeze of '99.

meanings.def: a short period of time, especially at night, when the temperature is below 0° Celsius
examples: A freeze warning was posted for Thursday night.
